ygData.subject: Travelling between Qeynos and Freeport
ygData.msgSnippet: Beholder is easy. For ANY Bard with a drum and the speed song. Just run, and don t stop. You may get attacked by 10 things but you ll outrun them all. There is
ygData.messageBody:
Beholder is easy. For ANY Bard with a drum and the speed song. Just run,
and don't stop. You may get attacked by 10 things but you'll outrun them
all. There is no getting lost. From East Karana just stay right, from
Runnyeye just stay left. Once in Runnyeye, from Beholder stay left, from
Misty Thicket, stay right. Nothing could be easier. I get bound to
Rivervale and go hunt in Paw, simply because Beholder simply is no threat
to our class.

Do watch out for the rare Evil Eye . . . he might have time to charm you.

-Musil

At 08:53 AM 5/13/99 , you wrote:
>From: Bob Stewart <bstewart@...>
>
>At 08:45 AM 5/13/99 -0700, jay schultze wrote:
>>I used to run back and forth from Freeport to Qeynos all the time (for many
>>different reasons)...sometimes I'd go to Qeynos and return to Freeport the
>>same day. Accelerando ROCKS!
>
>In another life I made the run from Freeport to Qeynos as a dwarf warrior
>of the 6th level, in the company of a much higher level group and with the
>benefit of Spirit of the Wolf for more speed. It was somewhat of an ordeal
>and I died twice trying to get through the minotaur pass, both times from
>being stunned and disoriented as I tried to run through. Without the work
>and indulgence of the group I wouldn't have made it. They even eventually
>recovered all my belongings from my corpse.
>
>As a 10th level bard with a 10th level cleric friend I'm getting more and
>more interested in wider travel either alone or the two of us, but my fear
>of the unknown keeps me from it. It would be helpful to hear of the
>adventures of other experienced travellers to help set my own expectations
>properly.
>
>My fears are 1) getting lost, and 2) getting in overwhelming trouble from
>getting into an area that's just too tough.
>
> Thrush
>
>
>------------------------------------------------------------------------
>Are you hogging all the fun?
>http://www.onelist.com
>Friends tell friends about ONElist!
>
